required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of LCI699 Compared to Placebo in Participants With Resistant Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo and Active Controlled, Parallel Group, Multi-center, Dose Ranging Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of LCI699 Compared to Placebo After 8 Weeks Treatment in Patients With Resistant Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: This study assessed the blood pressure effect, safety and tolerability of LCI699 compared to placebo and eplerenone in participants with resistant hypertension.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in MSSBP at Week 8 Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)
primary_outcome.description: Arterial blood pressure (BP) determinations were made after the participant was in the sitting position for 5 minutes according to the American Heart Association guidelines using a calibrated standard aneroid or mercury sphygmomanometer or a calibrated standard sphygmomanometer. The change in the MSSBP was calculated comparing the Week 8 readings to the readings taken at Baseline. The change from Baseline in MSSBP was analyzed using an analysis of covariance model (ANCOVA) with treatment and country as factors and Baseline MSSBP as a covariate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in MSDBP at Week 8 LOCF
secondary_outcome.description: Arterial BP determinations were made after the participant was in the sitting position for 5 minutes according to the American Heart Association guidelines using a calibrated standard aneroid or mercury sphygmomanometer or a calibrated standard sphygmomanometer. The change in the MSDBP was calculated comparing the Week 8 readings to the readings taken at Baseline. The change from Baseline in MSDBP was analyzed using an ANCOVA with treatment and country as factors and Baseline MSDBP as a covariate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a MSSBP Response and MSSBP Control at Week 8, as Measured by Office Blood Pressure (OBP)
secondary_outcome.description: MSSBP response was defined as the percentage of participants with a MSSBP <140 mmHg or a >=20 mmHg reduction from baseline reduction from baseline. MSSBP control was defined as the percentage of participants with a MSSBP <140 mmHg for non-diabetic participants and <130mHg for diabetic participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a MSDBP Response and MSDBP Control at Week 8, as Measured by OBP
secondary_outcome.description: MSDBP response was defined as the percentage of participants with a MSDBP <90 mmHg or a >=10 mmHg reduction from baseline. MSDBP control was defined as the percentage of participants with a MSDBP <90 mmHg for non-diabetic participants and <80mHg for diabetic participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dose/Exposure BP Response Relationship of LCI699, as Measured by Change From Baseline in MSSBP at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Arterial BP determinations were made after the participant was in the sitting position for 5 minutes according to the American Heart Association guidelines using a calibrated standard aneroid or mercury sphygmomanometer or a calibrated standard sphygmomanometer. The change in the MSSBP was calculated comparing the Week 8 readings to the readings taken at Baseline. The change from Baseline in MSSBP was analyzed using an ANCOVA with treatment and country as factors and Baseline MSSBP as a covariate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dose/Exposure BP Response Relationship of LCI699, as Measured by Change From Baseline in MSDBP at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Arterial BP determinations were made after the participant was in the sitting position for 5 minutes according to the American Heart Association guidelines using a calibrated standard aneroid or mercury sphygmomanometer or a calibrated standard sphygmomanometer. The change in the MSDBP was calculated comparing the Week 8 readings to the readings taken at Baseline. The change from Baseline in MSDBP was analyzed using an ANCOVA with treatment and country as factors and Baseline MSDBP as a covariate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean 24 Hours, Mean Daytime and Mean Nighttime Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) at Week 8 LOCF, as Measured by Ambulatory Blood Pressure Measurement (ABPM)
secondary_outcome.description: An ABPM measured a participant's blood pressure over a 24-hour period including daytime and nighttime readings, using an automated validated monitoring device from Baseline to Week 8. The 24-hour SBP was calculated by taking the mean of all ambulatory systolic blood pressure readings for the 24-hour period. The change from Baseline in SBP was analyzed using ANCOVA with treatment and country as factors and Baseline MSSBP as a covariate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean 24 Hours, Mean Daytime and Mean Nighttime Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) at Week 8 LOCF, as Measured by ABPM
secondary_outcome.description: An ABPM measured a participant's blood pressure over a 24-hour period including daytime and nighttime readings, using an automated validated monitoring device from Baseline to Week 8. The 24-hour DBP was calculated by taking the mean of all ambulatory diastolic blood pressure readings for the 24-hour period. The change from Baseline in DBP was analyzed using an ANCOVA with treatment and country as factors and Baseline MSDBP as a covariate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean 24 Hours, Mean Daytime and Mean Nighttime SBP in LCI699 1mg QD Versus LCI699 0.5mg BID Arm at Week 4, as Measured by ABPM
secondary_outcome.description: An ABPM measured a participant's blood pressure over a 24-hour period including daytime and nighttime readings using an automated validated monitoring device from Baseline to Week 4. The 24-hour SBP was calculated by taking the mean of all ambulatory systolic blood pressure readings for the 24-hour period. The change from Baseline in SBP was analyzed using an ANCOVA with treatment and country as factors and Baseline MSDBP as a covariate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean 24 Hours, Mean Daytime and Mean Nighttime DBP in LCI699 1mg QD Versus LCI699 0.5mg BID Arm at Week 4, as Measured by ABPM
secondary_outcome.description: An ABPM measured a participant's blood pressure over a 24-hour period including daytime and nighttime readings using an automated validated monitoring device from Baseline to Week 4. The 24-hour DBP was calculated by taking the mean of all ambulatory diastolic blood pressure readings for the 24-hour period. The change from Baseline in DBP was analyzed using an ANCOVA with treatment and country as factors and Baseline MSDBP as a covariate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Event (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Hyperkalemia, and Hyponatremia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: AEs, Hyperkalemia, and Hyponatremia: From start of the study drug treatment up to 10 weeks; SAE: From signing of the informed consent up to 10 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: An AE was an adverse medical event which occurs in a participant of the study and which is not necessarily in a causal relationship with the treatment the participant receives. SAEs were AEs leading to death, are life-threatening, require hospitalizations or prolongation of hospitalizations, represent an innate malformation or a congenital abnormality. Hyperkalemia was defined as potassium level >5.5 millimoles per liter (mmol/L). It is the medical term that describes a potassium level that's higher than normal. Hyponatremia was defined as sodium level <135 mmol/L. It is the medical term that describes a sodium level that's lesser than normal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Cortisol Levels Below 500 Nmol/L at 1 Hour After Adrenocorticotropic Hormone (ACTH) Injection at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Serum cortisol concentrations at 1 hour after injection were measured to assess the maximum stimulated cortisol level achieved. Potential adrenal suppression was indicated if the serum cortisol concentration was <500 nanomoles per liter (nmol/L) at 1 hour after the injection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Renin-Angiotensin-Aldosterone-System (RAAS) Biomarker: Plasma Aldosterone (PA) in LCI699 Compared to Eplerenone 50 mg at Week 8 LOCF
secondary_outcome.description: Percent change from Baseline was analyzed by ANCOVA model using PA values measured at Baseline and Week 8 LOCF, with treatment and country as factors and Baseline value as the covariate. Negative percent change from Baseline shows improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in RAAS Biomarker: Plasma Renin Activity (PRA) in LCI699 Compared to Eplerenone 50mg at Week 8 LOCF
secondary_outcome.description: Percent change from Baseline was analyzed by ANCOVA model using plasma renin values measured at Baseline and Week 8 LOCF, with treatment and country as factors and Baseline value as the covariate. Negative percent change from Baseline shows improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in RAAS Biomarker: Active Renin (ARC) in LCI699 Compared to Eplerenone 50mg at Week 8 LOCF
secondary_outcome.description: Percent change from Baseline was analyzed by ANCOVA model using active renin values measured at Baseline and Week 8 LOCF, with treatment and country as factors and Baseline value as the covariate. Negative percent change from Baseline shows improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in RAAS Biomarker: Ratio of PA to PRA in LCI699 Compared to Eplerenone 50mg at Week 8 LOCF
secondary_outcome.description: Percent change from Baseline was analyzed by ANCOVA model using percent ratio of PA to PRA values measured at Baseline and Week 8 LOCF, with treatment and country as factors and Baseline value as the covariate. Negative percent change from Baseline shows improvement.

arm_group.description: Following a 2-week placebo run-in period, participants received LCI699 0.25 mg, capsules, orally, twice daily (BID), with or without food for up to 8 weeks.
Following a 2-week placebo run-in period, participants received LCI699 1 mg, capsules, orally, once daily (QD), with or without food for up to 8 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: LCI699 0.5 mg followed by LCI699 1 mg BID
arm_group.description: Following a 2-week placebo run-in period, participants received LCI699 0.5 mg, capsules, orally, BID, with or without food for up to 4 weeks, followed by LCI699 1 mg, capsules, orally, BID with or without food for up to 4 weeks.
Following a 2-week placebo run-in period, participants received eplerenone 50 mg, capsules, orally, BID, with or without food for up to 8 weeks.

For a 2-week placebo run-in period, followed by 8 weeks of the treatment period, participants received LCI699-matching placebo or eplerenone-matching placebo, capsules, orally, QD or BID, with or without food.

intervention.arm_group_label: LCI699 0.5 mg followed by LCI699 1 mg BID

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Diagnosis of hypertension with mean sitting systolic blood pressure (MSSBP) ≥140 millimeters of mercury (mmHg) and <180 mmHg
- Stable on a three-drug regimen (including a diuretic) for at least 4 weeks for the treatment of resistant hypertension
- Male and female participants 18 to 75 years of age
Exclusion criteria:
- Recent history of myocardial infarction (MI), heart failure, unstable angina, coronary artery bypass graft, percutaneous coronary intervention, hypertensive encephalopathy, cerebrovascular accident, or transient ischemic attack
- Clinically significant electrocardiography (ECG) findings related to cardiac conduction defects
- Type 1 diabetes or uncontrolled type 2 diabetes (haemoglobin A1c [HbA1c] >9%)
- Malignancies within the last 5 years (excluding basal cell skin cancer)
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.

facility.name: Long Beach Center for Clinical Research

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants took part in this study at 35 investigative sites in the United States and in Iceland from 22 December 2008 to 13 October 2009.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants with a diagnosis of resistant hypertension were enrolled in a run-in period (Week -2 to 0). After that, the participants who fulfilled the inclusion criteria and did not meet any of the exclusion criteria at Week -2 and Week 0 were randomized to receive LCI699 or eplerenone in comparison with placebo for 8 weeks.

group.title: LCI699 0.25 mg BID
group.description: Following a 2-week placebo run-in period, participants received LCI699 0.25 mg, capsules, orally, twice daily (BID), with or without food for up to 8 weeks.

group.title: LCI699 1 mg QD
group.description: Following a 2-week placebo run-in period, participants received LCI699 1 mg, capsules, orally, once daily (QD), with or without food for up to 8 weeks.

group.title: LCI699 0.5 mg Followed by LCI699 1 mg BID
group.description: Following a 2-week placebo run-in period, participants received LCI699 0.5 mg, capsules, orally, BID, with or without food for up to 4 weeks, followed by LCI699 1 mg, capsules, orally, BID with or without food for up to 4 weeks.

group.title: Eplerenone 50 mg BID
group.description: Following a 2-week placebo run-in period, participants received eplerenone 50 mg, capsules, orally, BID, with or without food for up to 8 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: For a 2-week placebo run-in period, followed by 8 weeks of the treatment period, participants received LCI699-matching placebo or eplerenone-matching placebo, capsules, orally, QD or BID, with or without food.

baseline.population: Full Analysis set (FAS) population included all participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study drug.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

The 24-hour SBP was calculated by taking the mean of all ambulatory systolic blood pressure readings for the 24-hour period. The change from Baseline in SBP was analyzed using ANCOVA with treatment and country as factors and Baseline MSSBP as a covariate.
measure.population: FAS population included all participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study drug. Overall number of participants analyzed signifies the number of participants who were evaluable for this measure.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Mean 24 Hours, Mean Daytime and Mean Nighttime Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) at Week 8 LOCF, as Measured by ABPM
outcome.description: An ABPM measured a participant's blood pressure over a 24-hour period including daytime and nighttime readings, using an automated validated monitoring device from Baseline to Week 8. The 24-hour DBP was calculated by taking the mean of all ambulatory diastolic blood pressure readings for the 24-hour period. The change from Baseline in DBP was analyzed using an ANCOVA with treatment and country as factors and Baseline MSDBP as a covariate.
outcome.population: FAS population included all participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study drug. Overall number of participants analyzed signifies the number of participants who were evaluable for this measure.

group.title: LCI699 0.25 mg BID
group.description: Following a 2-week placebo run-in period, participants received LCI699 0.25 mg, capsules, orally, twice daily (BID), with or without food for up to 8 weeks

group.title: LCI699 1 mg QD
group.description: Following a 2-week placebo run-in period, participants received LCI699 1 mg, capsules, orally, once daily (QD), with or without food for up to 8 weeks.

group.title: LCI699 0.5 mg Followed by LCI699 1 mg BID
group.description: Following a 2-week placebo run-in period, participants received LCI699 0.5 mg, capsules, orally, BID, with or without food for up to 4 weeks, followed by LCI699 1 mg, capsules, orally, BID with or without food for up to 4 weeks.

group.title: Eplerenone 50 mg BID
group.description: Following a 2-week placebo run-in period, participants received eplerenone 50 mg, capsules, orally, BID, with or without food for up to 8 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: For a 2-week placebo run-in period, followed by 8 weeks of the treatment period, participants received LCI699-matching placebo or eplerenone-matching placebo, capsules, orally, QD or BID, with or without food.

measure.description: An ABPM measured a participant's blood pressure over a 24-hour period including daytime and nighttime readings, using an automated validated monitoring device from Baseline to Week 8. The 24-hour DBP was calculated by taking the mean of all ambulatory diastolic blood pressure readings for the 24-hour period. The change from Baseline in DBP was analyzed using an ANCOVA with treatment and country as factors and Baseline MSDBP as a covariate.

measure.description: An ABPM measured a participant's blood pressure over a 24-hour period including daytime and nighttime readings using an automated validated monitoring device from Baseline to Week 4. outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Event (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Hyperkalemia, and Hyponatremia
outcome.description: An AE was an adverse medical event which occurs in a participant of the study and which is not necessarily in a causal relationship with the treatment the participant receives. SAEs were AEs leading to death, are life-threatening, require hospitalizations or prolongation of hospitalizations, represent an innate malformation or a congenital abnormality. Hyperkalemia was defined as potassium level >5.5 millimoles per liter (mmol/L). It is the medical term that describes a potassium level that's higher than normal. Hyponatremia was defined as sodium level <135 mmol/L. It is the medical term that describes a sodium level that's lesser than normal.
outcome.time_frame: AEs, Hyperkalemia, and Hyponatremia: From start of the study drug treatment up to 10 weeks; SAE: From signing of the informed consent up to 10 weeks
outcome.population: Safety set population included all participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study drug. Here, Number Analyzed represents the number of participants who were evaluable for that specific category.

group.title: LCI699 0.25 mg BID
group.description: Following a 2-week placebo run-in period, participants received LCI699 0.25 mg, capsules, orally, twice daily (BID), with or without food for up to 8 weeks.

group.title: LCI699 1 mg QD
group.description: Following a 2-week placebo run-in period, participants received LCI699 1 mg, capsules, orally, once daily (QD), with or without food for up to 8 weeks.

group.title: LCI699 0.5 mg Followed by LCI699 1 mg BID
group.description: Following a 2-week placebo run-in period, participants received LCI699 0.5 mg, capsules, orally, BID, with or without food for up to 4 weeks, followed by LCI699 1 mg, capsules, orally, BID with or without food for up to 4 weeks.

group.title: Eplerenone 50 mg BID
group.description: Following a 2-week placebo run-in period, participants received eplerenone 50 mg, capsules, orally, BID, with or without food for up to 8 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: For a 2-week placebo run-in period, followed by 8 weeks of the treatment period, participants received LCI699-matching placebo or eplerenone-matching placebo, capsules, orally, QD or BID, with or without food.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Event (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Hyperkalemia, and Hyponatremia
measure.description: An AE was an adverse medical event which occurs in a participant of the study and which is not necessarily in a causal relationship with the treatment the participant receives. SAEs were AEs leading to death, are life-threatening, require hospitalizations or prolongation of hospitalizations, represent an innate malformation or a congenital abnormality. Hyperkalemia was defined as potassium level >5.5 millimoles per liter (mmol/L). It is the medical term that describes a potassium level that's higher than normal. Hyponatremia was defined as sodium level <135 mmol/L. It is the medical term that describes a sodium level that's lesser than normal.
measure.population: Safety set population included all participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study drug. Here, Number Analyzed represents the number of participants who were evaluable for that specific category.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Cortisol Levels Below 500 Nmol/L at 1 Hour After Adrenocorticotropic Hormone (ACTH) Injection at Week 8
outcome.description: Serum cortisol concentrations at 1 hour after injection were measured to assess the maximum stimulated cortisol level achieved. Potential adrenal suppression was indicated if the serum cortisol concentration was <500 nanomoles per liter (nmol/L) at 1 hour after the injection.
outcome.population: ACTH stimulation test subset population included all participants prior to treatment with LCI699 and at the end of the treatment interval (Week 8).

group.title: LCI699 0.25 mg BID
group.description: Following a 2-week placebo run-in period, participants received LCI699 0.25 mg, capsules, orally, twice daily (BID), with or without food for up to 8 weeks.

group.title: LCI699 1 mg QD
group.description: Following a 2-week placebo run-in period, participants received LCI699 1 mg, capsules, orally, once daily (QD), with or without food for up to 8 weeks.

group.title: Eplerenone 50 mg BID

group.title: Placebo
group.description: For a 2-week placebo run-in period, followed by 8 weeks of the treatment period, participants received LCI699-matching placebo or eplerenone-matching placebo, capsules, orally, QD or BID, with or without food.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Cortisol Levels Below 500 Nmol/L at 1 Hour After Adrenocorticotropic Hormone (ACTH) Injection at Week 8
measure.description: Serum cortisol concentrations at 1 hour after injection were measured to assess the maximum stimulated cortisol level achieved. Potential adrenal suppression was indicated if the serum cortisol concentration was <500 nanomoles per liter (nmol/L) at 1 hour after the injection.
measure.population: ACTH stimulation test subset population included all participants prior to treatment with LCI699 and at the end of the treatment interval (Week 8).

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Renin-Angiotensin-Aldosterone-System (RAAS) Biomarker: Plasma Aldosterone (PA) in LCI699 Compared to Eplerenone 50 mg at Week 8 LOCF
outcome.description: Percent change from Baseline was analyzed by ANCOVA model using PA values measured at Baseline and Week 8 LOCF, with treatment and country as factors and Baseline value as the covariate. Negative percent change from Baseline shows improvement.
outcome.population: FAS population included all participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study drug. Overall number of participants analyzed signifies the number of participants who were evaluable for this measure.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e., data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
